DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Eligibility Determination ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a medical procedure was performed that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Serum creatinine less than 1.
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine less than 1.5 mg/dl or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73m^2 using Cockcroft-Gault equation

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum Creatinine <=1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine <= 1.5 mg/dL or a calculated creatinine clearance of >= 50 ml/min (24-hour urine collection)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine <=1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine <=1.5 x ULN OR creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels >1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine <=1.5 x ULN; if >1.25 x ULN calculated creatinine clearance must be >=60 ml/min

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine less than or equal to Institutional ULN OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (calculated or measured)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the Serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.5 mg/dl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine <= 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's creatinine >1.5 x institutional ULN and/or creatinine clearance <60 mL/min due to non-Hodgkin's lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine <= 2.0 upper limit or normal OR creatinine clearance (est. DFT (Cockcroft-Gault)) >= 30 mL/min within 7 days prior to first dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine level within normal institutional limits OR a creatinine clearance of at least 60 mL/min within 14 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine Clearance >=70 mL/min/1.73 m2 or Serum Creatinine level within normal limits based on age/gender

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine Clearance >=70 mL/min/1.73 m2 or Serum Creatinine level within normal limits based on age/gender, per protocol

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a serum creatinine >3.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Estimated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 ml/min/1.73m^2 using Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine <= 2.0 mg/dL

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit normal (ULN) or measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (for subjects with creatinine levels 1.5 x greater than institutional  ULN).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >50 mL/min estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 Or Cal. Creatinine Clearance greater than or equal to 50

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine Met Criteria

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's Creatinine greater than the age-gender-specific norms established per Protocol Section 3.2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's Creatinine greater than 1.0 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Calculated Creatinine Clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min by Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance (CrCL) or estimated Glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) greater than 50 mL/min estimated using either the Cockcroft-Gault equation, the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study, or as reported in the comprehensive metabolic panel/basic metabolic panel (eGFR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's Creatinine > 1.5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does serum creatinine meet criteria outlined the protocol?

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
